messages: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:29): bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65: Can you remove the Previous version link to css3-border? It's a little misleading since that was merged into the draft a long time ago and the border definitions immediately previous aren't there
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:29): removed it for the editor's draft, but doesnt' have write access to w3.org
bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 (23:49): Fantasai, I checked with the webmaster and corrected it.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:49): Thanks!
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:50): bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65: I'm writing up a blog post for the css3-background publication
bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 (23:50): It's against policy to change a published TR, but it was less than 24 hours...
bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 (23:50): Good! (re: blog post)
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:51): I wanted to announce the draft, but also point out some of the issues we want feedback on
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:51): I'll be cross-posting between our blog and css3.info
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:51): My draft is here http://www.css3.info/?p=709 if you want to take a look :)
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:51): likes drafting in WordPress better
bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 (23:51): Shall I wait with announcing it on www-style so that I can point to the blog?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:51): yeah, sure!
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:52): I'm almost done :)
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:52): is just doing some editing to fix grammar errors and the like ;)
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:00): Why can't I link to external sites on the CSSWG blog?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:02): can't post this
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:02): needs to link to Brad's examples page, and to css3.info
bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 (00:07): Can't link? That's strange. There are other articles with links.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:07): Can you just put plain-text links?  It's crappy, but shrug.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:07): That's what I'm doing
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:07): slowly
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:07): it's complaining about something else
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:07): but it never gives line numbers
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:07): I HATE our blogging system
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:08): What's the engine?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:08): b2evo
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:08): (Won't be able to help, just curious.)
bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 (00:08): B.t.w., your URL gives me a page with just navigation links, no content.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:08): http://www.css3.info/css3-backgrounds-last-call/
bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 (00:09): That works, but it looks weird in lynx.
bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 (00:10): looks at the mark-up...
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:10): it's not my fault
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:10): I write good markup!
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:10): promises the <p> tags are all there
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:12): Oh, and it also won't let me use fragment identifiers in links to W3C specs
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:12): just removes those links
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:13): wtf is up with your blogging engine?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:13): That's crazy.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:15): http://www.w3.org/blog/CSS/2009/10/16/css3_background_lc
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:15): bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65, if you can fix that...
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:15): I give up
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:15): I hate W3C IT
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:15): which isn't fair
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:16): because they're shortstaffed
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:16): so they can't fix everything
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:16): but
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:16): really?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:16): banning fragment identifiers and external links?
bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 (00:16): I just made a test and fragments work fine.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:16): why doesn't it work for me?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:16): maybe you have magic priviledges
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:17): in that case you can fix the post!
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:17): Banning fragments doesn't even *start* to make sense.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:17): I had links to the relevant sections for the various properties mentioned in the post
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:17): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: I don't think it was intentional.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:18): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: I think they wanted to ban external links, and their regex forgot to allow fragments
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:18): or something
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:18): but it looks like bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 might be able to fix this
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:18): Still weird.  Whatever.
bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 (00:18): is looking at the post
bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 (00:18): It doesn't have a title.
bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 (00:18): What should it be called?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:18): doesn't understand why any link policy whatsoever is required on a w3c blog.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:19): "CSS3 Backgrounds and Borders Last Call for Comments"
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:19): should suffice I think
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:22): doesn't understand either
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:28): bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65, I'm still not seeing the title.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:28): Thanks for fixing the post, though
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:28): is not going to touch it anymore, in case it breaks again
bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 (00:29): Still not getting all the URLs. Which one is it complaining about...?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:32): bradclicks.com
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:32): "Rounding Extremes" should be linked to the url after it
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:32): border-break and background-break should be linked to
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:32): http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/WD-css3-background-20080910/#the-border-break and http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/WD-css3-background-20080910/#the-background-break
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:32): respectively
bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 (00:34): Yeah, it doesn't want to link to bradclicks.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:36): hm, maybe it was ok with css3.info then
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:36): and just didn't want to link to bradclicks or #the-border-break etc.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:36): just stripped out all the external URLs because she's run into similar problems before
bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 (00:48): It can't handle fragment IDs with dashes!?
bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65 (01:03): Worse: it accepts no dashes anywhere in a URL. :-(

25812bf456959aa5f28dc570f341a3ba (01:06): is 'CSS Working Group discussion'

3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (01:08): oh, so /that's/ the problem
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (01:08): bddfdb28870c5800d938fa0993c46d65, can we import our blog into some other system?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (01:08): Doesn't QA run MT?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (01:08): is pretty frustrated with our system overall
